TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program 1.0 Enters Experimental Testing

Articles.Content:
<figure data-orig-width="494" data-orig-height="186" class="tmblr-full"><img data-orig-width="494" data-orig-height="186" src="https://40.media.tumblr.com/d596c3006d99f40161ed2658d0e79a73/tumblr_inline_nm79atCAcG1rr2wit_540.png"/></figure><p>It’s official: Kerbal Space Program version 1.0 is leaving the QA testing stage and we’re moving to the final stage of testing: experimentals! </p><p>

The builds will soon be in the hands of a 100 person testing team who

will put the update through its paces before release to ensure we catch

all the bugs we can. </p><p> Are you interested in how the process works? Read more in <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/303"><b>this article</b></a> by Ted, our QA Lead.<a href="http://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fforum.kerbalspaceprogram.com%2Fcontent%2F303&h=nAQGJRidt&enc=AZPYbP60LGix5qnqLDCEymmQypVj6P8U3caoGKALA0Bor1w6AMyjCh-B51wiRstoaJBs6WSaFSdRTBk9yEqpvH5vtcVzwH7QgmdDK_hsDFfE8MwnjvUmuZ-AeW0UwL1lgzJ0djLcnRvdMTmscHHkzulhj9vNpzxhEGyftjaUkMtEcQ&s=1"></a></p>

awesome

Also: 100 tester? I didn't thought there was so much testers

(also, first )
Well, that was fast...

heh, you figure theres a good couple tens of thousands of players, if not hundreds in all, now think of 1 in a thousands a tester, and you got your hundred, also good job guys, heres hoping to a smooth testing cycle ( ooh if it just wasn't a lil smoother coming together we could have had a easter gift, oh well, hope its done before mothers day n,n
For some reason, I knew it was going to be about the game entering the Experimentals state a few hours ago after seeing a mention about what to look for on Twitter.
Yeah! Keep smashing the Bugs!
Congrats Squad, on reaching your latest milestone!
Good luck, Squad. Hope your confidence isn't for naught.

Wow! Happy you extended your initial release date by a couple of weeks due to overwhelming concerns by the community... Good luck

Kasper did you get us again with late April fools this time?
Good luck, hope to see 1.0 released in a "perfect" state

Woo-HOOOOOOOOOO!

TO THE HYPE-TRAAAAAAAIN!

You guys so missed the opportunity to totally pull the wool over our eyes and announce this yesterday!

Good job, congrats, I hope you know what you're doing, and oh boy I need to finish up my latest YouTube series!

Can we please have another episode of Ted's Build (Mis) Adventures showcasing the best bugs found (time providing of course)?

Even a brief rundown on the bugs squashed, be they old, new, hilarious, serious or otherwise?
Woohoo! (uninstalls mods)

Thinking about April Fool's, I was digging through the older posts for "The Daily Kerbal" and I happen to remember a particular release showed up on April Fool's Day last year.

The Asteroid Redirect Mission Update (23.5).
Ah good, i've gotten bored and have resorted to launching ballistic missiles at the KSC.

Can we please have another episode of Ted's Build (Mis) Adventures showcasing the best bugs found (time providing of course)?

I'm not familiar with this. Do you happen to have a link?
I offer this hearty box of imaginary cookies and favorite drinks to Ted and all the "Experimentals" team testers, who are currently hammering on the build!
Uh, oh, Kerbalun ale! (Kerbal koolaid)

Finished my exams, and now this news?

:D:D:D:D:D:D

awesome

Also: 100 tester? I didn't thought there was so much testers

(also, first )

Internally at SQUAD's QA, 100 testers would be doubtful. This game is developed by a very small team.

This is the point where SQUAD first starts letting a very few select trusted users outside the company get their hands on it and beat on it to see what they can break.

That's where that 100 figure is coming from, I assume. High profile members of the user community who've agreed to some special terms. (For example, developers of popular high-profile mods, who'd like a head start at seeing what update will do to their mods *before* the official release is out.)
Holy cow.
Great. Now I just need to finish up getting to Duna for the first time in over a year.
Excellent!
Wow, that was fast
